contribution_desc: The paper contributes ProtoAR, which is a "tool designed to investigate lightweight and creative ways to quickly transition from physical to digital prototyping of mobile AR apps". Although the core is about AR, and not cross-device interaction, the system allows to seamlessly switch between using a desktop system and mobile phone application to create an AR scene ("cross-device multi-layer authoring tools for live editing of mobile AR apps on phones").
crossdevice_def: "Second, it provides remote control of functions in the editor's view and capture panes. Inspired from cross-device authoring tools like XDStudio [29], this makes it possible to control the rendering of the AR interface and capture the phone's camera on either device without having to go back and forth between laptop and phone."
